CSSNamed-color.summary: The <named-color> CSS data type is the name of a color, such as red, blue, black, or lightseagreen. Syntactically, a <named-color> is an <ident>.

remarks.para: A <named-color> value can be used anywhere a <color> can be used.
-<color>: the data type of whose definition <named-color> is a constituent part.

CSSNamed-color.value: Named colors consists of standard colors, the transparent and currentcolor keywords.
